result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott L Ayala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days jail credit if probation is revoked

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  -No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-Random tests.
-No contact with victim.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott L Ayala in court with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court renders sentence. Defendant granted 404 days sentence credit unless jail records show differently. Court makes defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Court denies request for Challenge Incarceration Program.

Defendant Scott L Ayala in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. Defendant did not complete waiver form however Court approved oral waiver. Information filed. Defendant waives reading of information and enters not guilty plea. Defendant enters plea on 13CF276.
